properties.name: Artie Lange Book Signing
properties.description: Posted by Spewker   Comedian Artie Lange came to town and I recorded some very interesting video from his book signing. Lange has a best seller, "Too Fat to Fish" that he was promoting. Funny thing is, they really wouldn\'t let you talk to him unless you had bought the book or something else for him to sign. http://www.examiner.com/x-1423-Baltimore-Celebrity-Examiner~y2008m12d12-Loser-lovers-line-bookstore-for-Lange

properties.name: Batman Suffers Fate Worse Than Death
properties.description: Posted by Spewker    DC Comics decided Batman must die. But not just any death. A horrible, disgusting, hellish, squishy "fate worse than death." Yo boy. I couldn\'t wait for the publication to hit stores, so I wrote some "fate worse than death" scenarios of my own. One of them included a gig on a desert island, hence the marker. I think one of my funnier celebrity articles, but I\'ll let you be the judge. http://www.examiner.com/x-1423-Baltimore-Celebrity-Examiner~y2008m11d26-A-fate-worse-than-death-for-comic-super-hero-Batman

properties.name: Beverly Hilton Hotel
properties.description: Posted by Spewker   9876 Wilshire Blvd.I made winner predictions in movie and television categories for the 66th Annual Golden Globe Awards and got 9 out of 11 movie categories correct. Not bad for an amateur. Notice how I\'m not saying anything about my television choices.

properties.name: Cadillac Records NYC Premiere
properties.description: Posted by Spewker   They treated me like an interloper, so the story is pretty funny. I had a great time and was able to film most of the arrivals at the NYC "Cadillac Records" premiere at Manhattan\'s AMC Loew\'s Movie Theatre. http://www.examiner.com/x-1423-Baltimore-Celebrity-Examiner~y2008m12d2-Breaking-down-barriers-at-Cadillac-Records-premiere

properties.name: Celebrity Turkeys Spice Up Holidays
properties.description: Posted by Spewker  englandAmy Winehouse and Michael Jackson went birdy over Thanksgiving 2008. These two are over the top flamboyant, but do they have to be so damn weird? http://www.examiner.com/x-1423-Baltimore-Celebrity-Examiner~y2008m11d25-Celebrity-turkeys-spice-up-the-holidays

properties.name: Constantine Maroulis Interview at 2009 Greek Festival
properties.description: Posted by Spewker   Best Actor Tony Nominee Constantine Maroulis drops by St. Nicholas Greek Orthodox Church for Baltimore\'s 2009 Greek Folk Festival. We chat briefly in the bridal suite. Read full article at the link: http://www.examiner.com/x-1423-Baltimore-Celebrity-Examiner~y2009m6d12-Constantine-Maroulis-discusses-Baltimore-and-Tony-Awards-at-Greek-Folk-Festival

properties.name: Dan Lauria Visits Philly to Get Out the Vote
properties.description: Posted by Spewker  I didn\'t get enough time to crank out this article and there were several mistakes. But Dan Lauria (Dad from "Wonder Years") was a great interview subject. We spoke by telephone just before he was about to board a plane to Philly to help get out the vote for election 2008. Even though he is an ex-Marine, Lauria supported Barack Obama. http://www.examiner.com/x-1423-Baltimore-Celebrity-Examiner~y2008m10d31-Dan-Luria-and-Wendy-Malick-to-get-out-the-vote-in-Philadelphia

properties.name: Deborah Koons Garcia Interview
properties.description: Posted by Spewker  Deborah Koons Garcia is a filmmaker and artist. She\'s also the widow of Jerry Garcia, famous head musician of The Grateful Dead. I was lucky enough to meet her and interview her about her latest films, and those pesky Garcia Tapes. She was lovely and I\'m very glad we got the chance to chat. http://www.examiner.com/x-1423-Baltimore-Celebrity-Examiner~y2008m11d14-Future-of-food-activist-Deborah-Koons-Garcia-looking-bright

properties.name: Follow My Twitter Updates
properties.description: Posted by Spewker   Twitter is a very cool social networking tool I use to microblog. I have connected with various celebrities there as well, but mostly I use Twitter to find out the hot stories, websites, and videos of the day. There are all sorts of Twitter mashups and search tools unrelated to the site which I use as well. In general, I use Twitter a lot because it helps me connect with people using very little effort. My days are busy and filled with a lot more than just celebrity blogging. Twitter is a networking tool sent from heaven, and as far as I\'m concerned, everyone should connect this way online. I don\'t mindlessly follow the people who follow me, but I do check everyone out and introduce new follows on my stream. This helps them get acquainted with the site and introduce them to people who may drop by. Twitter headquarters is in San Francisco. I\'ve visited the area alot, but not lately. Anyway, if you\'re a person who likes to Twitter or just wants to check out what everyone is talking about, do check out my stream and feel free to tweet "Hello!" http://twitter.com/moanquivers

properties.name: Friends of CherylT
properties.description: Posted by Spewker   I\'m not going to candy coat this. I need Frappr friends. Help me out, won\'t you, and I won\'t be tempted to push you in the lake. FYI, that lake is right up the street from where I live and it\'s very picturesque. So even if you don\'t join my Frappr map, it\'s a very cool lake to hang out in. There\'s even shopping and restaurants nearby. http://www.frappr.com/cst2000

properties.name: Hanson at Rams Head Live
properties.description: Posted by Spewker   Hanson, the band, came to Baltimore at Rams Head Live. This is a pretty hopping spot at night. Bands from all over come to perform here. There\'s a video and and a short story about the band at the URL.

properties.name: Interview with Elissa Down
properties.description: Posted by Spewker

properties.name: Ira Glass
properties.description: Posted by Spewker    848 E. Grand Avenue in Chicago is the original home of "This American Life," the brainchild of Ira Glass, a personal friend. Many people think Ira is from Illinois, but the truth is that Ira and I grew up together in Baltimore, MD - same neighborhood, same schools. We often collaborated on plays, him mostly writing and directing, me mostly singing and acting, although there was a year when we wrote a play together. We also entertained at children\'s birthday parties during Middle School, him doing magic and me doing ventriloquism. I absolutely adore his incredibly popular program, TAL, which you can catch on NPR radio and Showtime TV. The DVDs should be out soon. Ira has also penned a couple of books that you can order online from Amazon.com or purchase at Borders, Barnes & Noble, etc.

properties.name: Michael Phelps and Caroline
properties.description: Posted by Spewker    Olympic champion Michael Phelps may belong to the world, but he lives in Baltimore overlooking the Inner Harbor in some penthouse - don\'t ask me where. His training facility is down the street from me. Baltimoreans are having a blast following Phelps exploits - the latest one is about his older Vegas girlfriends who he brought home for Thanksgiving. The local paper is having a field day with this story. Just thought you might like the basic outline from Bitten and Bound.

properties.name: Mickey Rourke
properties.description: Posted by Spewker   Los AngelesMickey Rourke was once a promising young actor - gorgeous and on his way to the top. Then he did something very stupid. He left the profession. After chiseling his once gorgeous visage into a boxer\'s face, he is now on the acting comeback trail. Read about his journey and celebrate the winner of the best actor award in a movie picture drama at the 2009 Golden Globe Awards.

properties.name: My In-Laws
properties.description: Posted by Spewker       I write about celebrity news and gossip, but my true passion is family. My husband\'s sister and her family live in Chicago and we try to visit them as much as possible. This picture was taken with some extended family on an outing to Navy Pier which was so fun. It was during the summer and we rented one of those funny pedal carts. People were enjoying the lake, picnicing on the beach, throwing frisbees, and generally having a good time. There was free entertainment inside the shops and a good deal of other family fun activities, like a children\'s museum and exhibits.

properties.name: Not exactly live coverage of Barack Obama inauguration
properties.description: Posted by Spewker        I love politics and live within 45 minutes of Washington, D.C. So what was I doing in Ben Yehuda Square during Barack Obama\'s historic presidential inauguration? Lamenting the fact that I had purchased my tickets to Israel back in October, 2008. Back then, it was unclear who would win the election. On Inauguration Day 2009, I was millions of miles away (or so it seemed) on the other side of the world, watching everything unfold from a satellite feed 7-hours later. Pretty cool. Ben Yehuda Square is a great place to hang out. There are shops, street musicians, cafes, and loads of Israeli culture. On the day of the inauguration, a camera crew from Germany was filming people\'s thoughts and hopes for Obama\'s presidency. I volunteered to be filmed. http://www.examiner.com/x-1423-Baltimore-Celebrity-Examiner~y2009m1d20-Not-exactly-live-coverage-of-Barack-Obama-inauguration?cid=exrss-Baltimore-Celebrity-Examiner

properties.name: OK! Magazine Faces Wrath of Madonna
properties.description: Posted by Spewker  I have no idea if this is Madonna\'s L.A. home. I just know that if you make the kind of money she\'s pulling in -- from concerts, licensing fees, and lawsuits -- you can afford a tony house in Malibu right next to the beach. Madonna won a lawsuit against British tabloid Mail on Sunday for publishing photographs of her wedding to Guy Richie on the day they announced their split. The photos were "stolen" and printed without permission. Now, apparently, OK! Magazine has run afoul of the Material Girl. Read how and why at the link. http://www.examiner.com/x-1423-Baltimore-Celebrity-Examiner~y2008m12d9-Madonna-wedding-photos-showdown-might-obliterate-OK

properties.name: Paparazzi Brawl Erupts Over Paris Hilton
properties.description: Posted by Spewker   Shocking paparazzi melee bloodying the face of one and leaving another unconscious after Paris Hilton and her new BFF Brittany exit Bar DeLuxe in L.A. See the unbelievable video at the link. http://www.examiner.com/x-1423-Baltimore-Celebrity-Examiner~y2008m12d10-Paris-Hilton-paparazzi-brawl-sheds-blood-renders-one-unconscious

properties.name: Stage 46: The Reality of Reality TV
properties.description: Posted by Spewker   A new tell all book came with a description in my gmail account. It looked intriguing. I decided to contact the author for an article. The guy wrote the book under a pseudonym to protect the guilty. A behind the scenes look at reality TV. He originally hailed from Bakersfield and is now working on the sequel. http://www.examiner.com/x-1423-Baltimore-Celebrity-Examiner~y2008m11d28-Going-behind-the-scenes-of-Stage-46-The-Reality-of-Reality-Television

properties.name: The Curious Case of Benjamin Buttons Premiere
properties.description: Posted by Spewker     Special screening of Brad Pitt Christmas Day release, "The Curious Case of Benjamin Button" at Mann\'s Village Theatre. Brangelina and parents of Brad Pitt walk the red carpet.

properties.name: Tina Fey don't need no dolla to holla, haters
properties.description: Posted by Spewker Ugh! Tina Fey hounded by TMZ paps at LAX turned my stomach. This marker memorializes the approximate location of Fey\'s brilliant comedy show, 30 Rock. I say it\'s time for the haters to stop ragging on Fey so that she can concentrate on more important matters, like keep her adoring public entertained. What are your thoughts? http://www.examiner.com/x-1423-Baltimore-Celebrity-Examiner~y2009m1d14-Tina-Fey-dont-need-no-dolla-to-holla-haters?cid=exrss-Baltimore-Celebrity-Examiner

properties.name: Tony Bennett donates portrait of Duke Ellington
properties.description: Posted by Spewker   Legendary entertainer Tony Bennett discusses his art work, Duke Ellington, and life lessons at the Smithsonian National Portrait Gallery on the National Mall located at 8th and G Streets, N.W.
